titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas Woodward, Indictment
CWG6552

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
AGAINST
Thomas Woodward
Jefferson Circuit Court,
May Term, A. D. 1864.

The Grand Jurors of the County of Jefferson in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Thomas Woodward of the Crime of Murder committed in the manner and form as follows, to=wit: The said Thos Woodward in the said County of Jefferson on the day of March A. D. 1864, with force and arms feloniously did take steal and carry away did wilfully wickedly, feloniously and of his malice aforethought Kill and murder Christian Baker by stabbing him in and upon his body and back and hip and thigh with a Knife and sharp and dangerous and deadly instrument and weapon contrary to the form of the statute in such cases, made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Witnesses:
Jas P Gill, Wm Delph Zachara Meyers Wm Pennally Henry Faust Ed Foust Jas Hardin Jas F Lee Jacob Richards Dr Knapp
A Copy att Jas P Chambers c

Jefferson Cir Ct
The Commonwealth of Kentucky.
vs } Indictment. Murder
Thomas Woodward
A True Bill.

1864 May 4. Rec from Grand Jury & filed
att J P Chambers
